title: Trapezoidal sum of accumulation function part - c

content.question: If the average rate of change of F on the closed interval [1,3] is k, find <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> in terms of k.

frqParts.text: If the average rate of change of F on the closed interval [1,3] is k, find <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <mi>sin</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> </math> in terms of k.

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
